Title.evidence: Intraosseous Versus Systemic Administration of Cefazolin in Primary Total Knee Arthroplasty: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomly assigned to two groups

Intervention.evidence: Group 1 (n=11) received 1 g cefazolin systemically... Group 2 (n=11) received 1 g cefazolin intraosseously

Objective.evidence: This study aims to compare the tissue concentrations of cefazolin achieved through systemic versus regional intraosseous administration.

Method_Outcome.evidence: antibiotic concentrations were measured using high-performance liquid chromatography

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed using sealed envelopes.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The mean tissue concentration of cefazolin in subcutaneous fat was 186 ug/g in the intraosseous group and 11 ug/g in the systemic group.

Harms.evidence: No adverse events were reported in either group.

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not provided.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding information were not provided.
